Title: Why you wake up tired: 5 mistakes to avoid at night
Summary: Waking up tired even after sleeping all night? That’s a sign something is off . Sleep is supposed to recharge you, but certain habits before bedtime can ruin the quality of your rest . Here are five common mistakes confirmed by experts .

Title: Group urges FG to enforce policies on food, beverages to reduce deadly diseases
Summary: Group urges FG to enforce policies on food, beverages to reduce deadly diseases . Organisation under the auspices of the Corporate Accountability and Public Participation Africa (CAPPA) demands the implementation of Federal Government policies designed to reduce the rising cases of deaths traced to non-communicable diseases .

Title: PDP youths reject Taraba bye-election results
Summary: The youth wing of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Karim 1 Constituency, Taraba State, has strongly rejected the outcome of the August 16 bye-election . They allege widespread irregularities and electoral malpractice . Addressing journalists in Jalingo, the PDP Youth

Title: 2025 International Badminton Classic starts today in Lagos
Summary: 2025 Lagos International Badminton Classic is scheduled to take place from August 27–30 at the Teslim Balogun Indoor Sports Hall in Surulere . Lagos is set to become the centre of African badminton next year .

Title: Osun monarch jailed 56 months in US for $4.2m COVID-19 relief fraud
Summary: Oba Joseph Oloyede, the Apetu of Ipetumodu in Osun State, has been sentenced to 56 months in prison . The 62-year-old dual U.S.-Nigerian citizen, who resides in Ohio, was jailed for $4.2m COVID-19 relief fraud .

Title: Founders now battling to reclaim Newswatch – Yakubu Mohammed
Summary: Mohammed said that the founders had decided to expand the operations of the weekly magazine in 2011, after 25 years of successfully publishing it . Mohammed said the founders of Newswatch had decided not to expand operations in 2011 . The founders are now battling to reclaim the title .

Title: Full List: Pots confirmed for 2025/26 Champions League draw
Summary: The pots for the Champions League 2025/26 draw take shape . Pots confirmed for 2025/27 Champions League draw . The draw will take place in the summer of 2015-16 .

Title: Our commitment to integrity, transparency, accountability in governance unwavering – Obidients
Summary: Supporters of the 2023 Candidate of the Labour Party (LP), Mr. Peter Obi, have reaffirmed their unwavering commitment to integrity, transparency, and accountable leadership in line with Obi’s vision . Title: Group fumes over rights abuse against NYSC member in Anambra
Summary: The West Africa Youth Protection and Advocacy Network (WAYPAN) condemned the reported assault of National Youth Service Corps (NYSC) members by operatives of the Agunechemba security outfit in Anambra State . The incident involved the violent stripping and assault of a female corps member, captured on camera .

Title: Periodic elections alone don’t guarantee true democracy – NALT
Summary: The National Association of Liberated Tigers (NALT) urges African nations to build stronger institutions and practices that uphold genuine democratic values . This message was the highlight of the 2025 International Convention and Conference of NALT .

Title: Participate in ongoing voter registration, CAN urges Nigerians
Summary: The Christian Association of Nigeria in the 19 Northern states and the Federal Capital Territory has urged Nigerians to actively participate in the ongoing Continuous Voter Registration exercise being conducted by the Independent National Electoral Commission . Title: Customs boss seeks PPP in modernising trade operations
Summary: The Nigeria Customs Service pledged to strengthen its partnership with the private sector to improve trade facilitation and border management across the country . Comptroller-General of Customs, Bashir Adeniyi, gave the assurance during a courtesy visit by the new leadership of the Nigerian Association of Chambers of Commerce, Industry, Mines, and Agriculture held on Thursday

Title: Alaafin lacks authority beyond Oyo - Ex-gov aide
Summary: Doyin Odebowale has criticised the Alaafin of Oyo, Oba Abimbola Owoade, over his demand that the Ooni of Ife revoke a chieftaincy title recently conferred on an Ibadan-based businessman . The former aide said traditional rulers have authority only within their local government

Title: Nigeria's creative industry contributes ₦1.3tn to GDP — Kaduna deputy gov
Summary: Kaduna State Government reaffirms commitment to supporting the creative industry as part of its strategy for youth empowerment and economic development . The 8th Kaduna International Film Festival runs from August 26 to 30, featuring films from over 15 countries . Title: Jonathan slams party defections, demands electoral reforms
Summary: Ex-President Goodluck Jonathan has called for sweeping reforms in Nigeria’s electoral system to strengthen democracy, enhance accountability, and ensure the legitimacy of elections . Jonathan spoke at the National Action Plan for Electoral Reform Dialogue held on Wednesday in Abuja .
